concept.title: Arrays of components in the Mechanical Browser

conbody.p: Arrays of components are represented as special nodes in the Mechanical Browser. They are named after the array type (Rectangular, Polar, or Path) followed with semicolon and the index of the array (for example, Rectangular:1, Polar:2, Path:3). These nodes have the same properties as regular associative arrays. The properties can be used to change the number of elements in the array, distance/angle between them, and other array parameters. You can also assign a persistent expression to any property. It will be used to automatically recompute the value of the property upon changing its driving parameters.

Each array node has 2 child nodes; Source and Elements:
Under Source node you can find the inserted component and its parameters.
Elements node can be expanded into a list of array elements, with the possibility to hide or change the visual style of a particular element inside the array.
